channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Portugal Searches for Cause of Lisbon Funicular Crash as Death Toll Rises
item.description: The authorities were also working to identify the 17 victims, who they said had Portuguese and foreign surnames. The funicular is popular with tourist...

item.title: What Can Democrats Do to Get Rid of the Scarlet L for Loser?
item.description: Is there a way for them to get rid of the scarlet L, for loser?

item.title: Tennis champion Coco Gauff loves this $2 monthly subscription, cooks TikTok recipes, and treats herself with $3,000 shopping sprees
item.description: 21-year-old star athlete Coco Gauff has been breaking tennis records for years—but the multimillionaire doesn’t pay for her own Netflix, shops second-...

item.title: Russia Wants ‘Security Guarantees’ Too. Here’s What They Look Like.
item.description: The Kremlin’s vision of national security comes at the expense of Ukrainian sovereignty, underlining the challenges of striking a peace deal.

item.title: Europe Aims to Show It Is Ready to Secure Postwar Ukraine
item.description: President Emmanuel Macron of France is hosting a meeting of leaders who will review options for protecting any peace with Russia.

item.title: The price of gold could hit $5,000 if Trump keeps meddling with the Fed, Goldman Sachs says
item.description: "Gold is a store of value that doesn’t rely on institutional trust,” Samantha Dart says.

item.title: Florida Moves to End Vaccine Mandates, and Trump Battles Wind Farms
item.description: Plus, a Chinese coffee giant comes to America.

item.title: Starbucks hops on the health craze with protein coffee weight-loss influencers had been concocting in its drive thru for months
item.description: Protein lattes and cold foam will roll out in U.S. and Canada stores starting Sept. 29, the company announced this week.

item.title: Exclusive: Fintech startup Ramp hits $1 billion in annualized revenue after notching $22.5 billion valuation
item.description: The six-year-old company is rebuilding corporate credit cards and expense reports with funding from Founders Fund, Iconiq, and Khosla Ventures.

item.title: Ray Dalio says ‘most people are silent’ because they’re afraid to talk about what’s really happening with the U.S. economy
item.description: Bridgewater's billionaire founder sees dangerous 1930s parallels as government intervention increases and debt reaches World War II levels.

item.title: Europe Aims to Show It Is Ready to Secure Postwar Ukraine
item.description: President Emmanuel Macron of France is hosting a meeting of leaders who will review options for protecting any peace with Russia.

item.title: U.S. Defends Boat Strike
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said military operations against Venezuelan cartels would continue.

item.title: Vetements Takes Its Trademark Fight to U.S. Supreme Court
item.description: Why does Veuve Clicquot get a U.S. trademark while Vetements — home of the packing-tape minidress, no less! — does not? Its lawyers want to know.
